mn113:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
mn113:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

mn113:1.3.eng: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

mn113:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the qualities of a true person and the qualities of an untrue person.

mn113:2.2.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
mn113:2.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

mn113:2.3.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

mn113:3.1.eng: “And what is a quality of an untrue person?

mn113:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, asappuriso uccākulā pabbajito hoti.
mn113:3.2.eng: Take an untrue person who has gone forth from an eminent family.

mn113:3.4.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi uccākulā pabbajito, ime panaññe bhikkhū na uccākulā pabbajitā’ti.
mn113:3.4.eng: ‘I have gone forth from an eminent family, unlike these other mendicants.’

mn113:3.5.pli: So tāya uccākulīnatāya attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:3.5.eng: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.

mn113:3.6.eng: This is a quality of an untrue person.

mn113:3.7.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:3.8.pli: ‘na kho uccākulīnatāya lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.
mn113:3.8.eng: ‘It’s not because of one’s eminent family that thoughts of greed, hate, or delusion come to an end.

mn113:3.9.eng: Even if someone has not gone forth from an eminent family,

mn113:3.10.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.
mn113:3.10.eng: if they practice in line with the teaching, practice properly, and live in line with the teaching, they are worthy of honor and praise for that.’

mn113:3.11.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tāya uccākulīnatāya nevattānukkaṃseti na paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:3.11.eng: Keeping the practice to themselves, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their eminent family.
mn113:3.11.comm: By rejecting social measures of worth and focusing on inner purity, they are the opposite of the meditator at MN 108:26.4, who hides defilements within.

mn113:3.12.eng: This is a quality of a true person.

mn113:4-6.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso mahākulā pabbajito hoti …pe…
mn113:4-6.1.eng: Furthermore, take an untrue person who has gone forth from a great family …

mn113:4-6.5.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi uḷārabhogakulā pabbajito, ime panaññe bhikkhū na uḷārabhogakulā pabbajitā’ti.
mn113:4-6.5.eng: ‘I have gone forth from an extremely wealthy family, unlike these other mendicants.’

mn113:4-6.6.pli: So tāya uḷārabhogatāya attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:4-6.6.eng: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.

mn113:4-6.7.eng: This too is a quality of an untrue person.

mn113:4-6.8.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:4-6.9.pli: ‘na kho uḷārabhogatāya lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.
mn113:4-6.9.eng: ‘It’s not because of one’s extremely wealthy family that thoughts of greed, hate, or delusion come to an end.

mn113:4-6.10.eng: Even if someone has not gone forth from an extremely wealthy family,

mn113:4-6.11.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.
mn113:4-6.11.eng: if they practice in line with the teaching, practice properly, and live in line with the teaching, they are worthy of honor and praise for that.’

mn113:4-6.12.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tāya uḷārabhogatāya nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:4-6.12.eng: Keeping the practice to themselves, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their extremely wealthy family.

mn113:4-6.13.eng: This too is a quality of a true person.

mn113:7.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso ñāto hoti yasassī.
mn113:7.1.eng: Furthermore, take an untrue person who is well-known and famous.

mn113:7.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi ñāto yasassī, ime panaññe bhikkhū appaññātā appesakkhā’ti.
mn113:7.3.eng: ‘I’m well-known and famous. These other mendicants are obscure and insignificant.’

mn113:7.4.pli: So tena ñattena attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:7.4.eng: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.

mn113:7.5.eng: This too is a quality of an untrue person.

mn113:7.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:7.7.pli: ‘na kho ñattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.
mn113:7.7.eng: ‘It’s not because of one’s fame that thoughts of greed, hate, or delusion come to an end.

mn113:7.8.eng: Even if someone is not well-known and famous,

mn113:7.9.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.
mn113:7.9.eng: if they practice in line with the teaching, practice properly, and live in line with the teaching, they are worthy of honor and praise for that.’

mn113:7.10.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tena ñattena nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:7.10.eng: Keeping the practice to themselves, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their fame.

mn113:7.11.eng: This too is a quality of a true person.

mn113:8.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
mn113:8.1.eng: Furthermore, take an untrue person who receives robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

mn113:8.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi lābhī cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ, ime panaññe bhikkhū na lābhino cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānan’ti.
mn113:8.3.eng: ‘I receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick, unlike these other mendicants.’

mn113:8.4.pli: So tena lābhena attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:8.4.eng: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.

mn113:8.5.eng: This too is a quality of an untrue person.

mn113:8.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:8.7.pli: ‘na kho lābhena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.
mn113:8.7.eng: ‘It’s not because of one’s material things that thoughts of greed, hate, or delusion come to an end.

mn113:8.8.eng: Even if someone doesn’t receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick,

mn113:8.9.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.
mn113:8.9.eng: if they practice in line with the teaching, practice properly, and live in line with the teaching, they are worthy of honor and praise for that.’

mn113:8.10.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tena lābhena nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:8.10.eng: Keeping the practice to themselves, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their material things.

mn113:8.11.eng: This too is a quality of a true person.

mn113:9.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso bahussuto hoti.
mn113:9.1.eng: Furthermore, take an untrue person who is very learned …

mn113:9.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi bahussuto, ime panaññe bhikkhū na bahussutā’ti.

mn113:9.4.pli: So tena bāhusaccena attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:9.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:9.7.pli: ‘na kho bāhusaccena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

mn113:9.9.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.

mn113:9.10.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tena bāhusaccena nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:10.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso vinayadharo hoti.
mn113:10.1.eng: who is an expert in the monastic law …

mn113:10.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi vinayadharo, ime panaññe bhikkhū na vinayadharā’ti.

mn113:10.4.pli: So tena vinayadharattena attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:10.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:10.7.pli: ‘na kho vinayadharattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

mn113:10.9.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.

mn113:10.10.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tena vinayadharattena nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:11.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso dhammakathiko hoti.

mn113:11.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi dhammakathiko, ime panaññe bhikkhū na dhammakathikā’ti.

mn113:11.4.pli: So tena dhammakathikattena attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:11.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:11.7.pli: ‘na kho dhammakathikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

mn113:11.9.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.

mn113:11.10.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tena dhammakathikattena nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:12.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso āraññiko hoti.

mn113:12.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi āraññiko ime panaññe bhikkhū na āraññikā’ti.

mn113:12.4.pli: So tena āraññikattena attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:12.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:12.7.pli: ‘na kho āraññikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

mn113:12.9.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.

mn113:12.10.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tena āraññikattena nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:13.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso paṃsukūliko hoti.
mn113:13.1.eng: who is a rag robe wearer …

mn113:13.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi paṃsukūliko, ime panaññe bhikkhū na paṃsukūlikā’ti.

mn113:13.4.pli: So tena paṃsukūlikattena attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:13.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:13.7.pli: ‘na kho paṃsukūlikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

mn113:13.9.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.

mn113:13.10.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tena paṃsukūlikattena nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:14.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso piṇḍapātiko hoti.

mn113:14.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi piṇḍapātiko, ime panaññe bhikkhū na piṇḍapātikā’ti.

mn113:14.4.pli: So tena piṇḍapātikattena attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:14.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:14.7.pli: ‘na kho piṇḍapātikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

mn113:14.9.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.

mn113:14.10.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tena piṇḍapātikattena nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:15.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso rukkhamūliko hoti.
mn113:15.1.eng: who stays at the root of a tree …

mn113:15.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi rukkhamūliko, ime panaññe bhikkhū na rukkhamūlikā’ti.

mn113:15.4.pli: So tena rukkhamūlikattena attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:15.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:15.7.pli: ‘na kho rukkhamūlikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

mn113:15.9.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.

mn113:15.10.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tena rukkhamūlikattena nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:16-20.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sosāniko hoti …pe…
mn113:16-20.1.eng: who stays in a charnel ground …

mn113:16-20.2.eng: who stays in the open air …

mn113:16-20.4.eng: who sleeps wherever they lay their mat …

mn113:16-20.5.eng: who eats in one sitting per day.

mn113:16-20.7.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi ekāsaniko, ime panaññe bhikkhū na ekāsanikā’ti.
mn113:16-20.7.eng: ‘I eat in one sitting per day, unlike these other mendicants.’

mn113:16-20.8.pli: So tena ekāsanikattena attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:16-20.8.eng: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.

mn113:16-20.9.eng: This too is a quality of an untrue person.

mn113:16-20.10.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:16-20.11.pli: ‘na kho ekāsanikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.
mn113:16-20.11.eng: ‘It’s not because of eating in one sitting per day that thoughts of greed, hate, or delusion come to an end.

mn113:16-20.12.eng: Even if someone eats in more than one sitting per day,

mn113:16-20.13.pli: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṃso’ti.
mn113:16-20.13.eng: if they practice in line with the teaching, practice properly, and live in line with the teaching, they are worthy of honor and praise for that.’

mn113:16-20.14.pli: So paṭipadaṃyeva antaraṃ karitvā tena ekāsanikattena nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:16-20.14.eng: Keeping the practice to themselves, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their eating in one sitting per day.

mn113:16-20.15.eng: This too is a quality of a true person.

mn113:21.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
mn113:21.1.eng: Furthermore, take an untrue person who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.

mn113:21.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi paṭhamajjhānasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū paṭhamajjhānasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
mn113:21.3.eng: ‘I have attained the first absorption, unlike these other mendicants.’

mn113:21.4.pli: So tāya paṭhamajjhānasamāpattiyā attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:21.4.eng: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.

mn113:21.5.eng: This too is a quality of an untrue person.

mn113:21.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:21.7.eng: ‘The Buddha has spoken of not being determined even by the attainment of the first absorption.
mn113:21.7.comm: For atammayatā see MN 47:13.4 and my note there. Here it means that one’s spiritual goal is not limited to this attainment.

mn113:21.8.pli: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṃ hoti aññathā’ti.
mn113:21.8.eng: For whatever they imagine it is, it turns out to be something else.’
mn113:21.8.comm: This saying also appears at Snp 3.8:15.1 and Snp 3.12:52.1, where it is not connected with absorption practice.

mn113:21.9.pli: So atammayataññeva antaraṃ karitvā tāya paṭhamajjhānasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:21.9.eng: Keeping to themselves the fact that they are not determined by that, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their attainment of the first absorption.

mn113:21.10.eng: This too is a quality of a true person.

mn113:22-24.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ …pe…
mn113:22-24.1.eng: Furthermore, take an untrue person who, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, enters and remains in the second absorption …

mn113:22-24.5.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi catutthajjhānasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū catutthajjhānasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
mn113:22-24.5.eng: ‘I have attained the fourth absorption, unlike these other mendicants.’

mn113:22-24.6.pli: So tāya catutthajjhānasamāpattiyā attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:22-24.6.eng: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.

mn113:22-24.7.eng: This too is a quality of an untrue person.

mn113:22-24.8.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:22-24.9.eng: ‘The Buddha has spoken of not being determined even by the attainment of the fourth absorption.

mn113:22-24.10.pli: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṃ hoti aññathā’ti.
mn113:22-24.10.eng: For whatever they imagine it is, it turns out to be something else.’

mn113:22-24.11.pli: So atammayataññeva antaraṃ karitvā tāya catutthajjhānasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:22-24.11.eng: Keeping to themselves the fact that they are not determined by that, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their attainment of the fourth absorption.

mn113:22-24.12.eng: This too is a quality of a true person.

mn113:25.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṃ atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā ‘ananto ākāso’ti ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati.
mn113:25.1.eng: Furthermore, take an untrue person who, going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the disappearance of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite space …

mn113:25.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.

mn113:25.4.pli: So tāya ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:25.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:25.8.pli: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṃ hoti aññathā’ti.

mn113:25.9.pli: So atammayataññeva antaraṃ karitvā tāya ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:26.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ samatikkamma ‘anantaṃ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati.

mn113:26.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.

mn113:26.4.pli: So tāya viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:26.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:26.8.pli: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṃ hoti aññathā’ti.

mn113:26.9.pli: So atammayataññeva antaraṃ karitvā tāya viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:27.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṃ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati.

mn113:27.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.

mn113:27.4.pli: So tāya ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:27.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:27.8.pli: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṃ hoti aññathā’ti.

mn113:27.9.pli: So atammayataññeva antaraṃ karitvā tāya ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.

mn113:28.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati.
mn113:28.1.eng: the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.

mn113:28.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ khomhi nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
mn113:28.3.eng: ‘I have attained the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, unlike these other mendicants.’

mn113:28.4.pli: So tāya nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā attānukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:28.4.eng: And they glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.

mn113:28.5.eng: This too is a quality of an untrue person.

mn113:28.6.pli: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:

mn113:28.7.eng: ‘The Buddha has spoken of not being determined even by the attainment of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.

mn113:28.8.pli: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṃ hoti aññathā’ti.
mn113:28.8.eng: For whatever they imagine it is, it turns out to be something else.’

mn113:28.9.pli: So atammayataññeva antaraṃ karitvā tāya nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti.
mn113:28.9.eng: Keeping to themselves the fact that they are not determined by that, they don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of their attainment of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.

mn113:28.10.eng: This too is a quality of a true person.

mn113:29.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sappuriso sabbaso nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ samatikkamma saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ upasampajja viharati. Paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.
mn113:29.1.eng: Furthermore, take a true person who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.

mn113:29.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na kiñci maññati, na kuhiñci maññati, na kenaci maññatī”ti.
mn113:29.2.eng: This is a mendicant who does not conceive with anything, does not conceive regarding anything, does not conceive through anything.”

mn113:29.3.eng: That is what the Buddha said.

mn113:29.4.pli: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandunti.
mn113:29.4.eng: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what the Buddha said.
